page.title: 03TRANSPORT
page.content: The main form of public transport in Renfrew is by bus. Bus services tend to run via Renfrew from Glasgow to destinations such as Paisley,Erskine, Greenock and Largs. There are also services running from Inchinnan Garage between Paisley and the local area eg Renfrew Ferry, Erskine. A service also connects with the Glasgow Underground Network at Govan Cross. Buses are operated by the Scottish Transport Group. The fare from Renfrew to Glasgow is 55p. The nearest railway station is in Paisley which connects with the Clyde coast and Glasgow (for mainline connections north and south). The fare from Paisley to Glasgow is 70p. Renfrew is also a commuter suburb, with easy access to the M8 motorway which runs from Greenock via Glasgow to Edinburgh and connects with the southbound and northbound M-ways.
